resources.string: The goal is to get a hand total closer to 21 than the dealer, without going over 21 (busting).
Number cards are their face value. Face cards (King, Queen, Jack) are 10. Aces can be 1 or 11.
Take another card. You can hit as many times as you want, but if your total exceeds 21, you bust and lose.
Keep your current hand and end your turn. The dealer then plays their hand.
Double your initial bet and receive only one more card. This is often a good move when your first two cards total 9, 10, or 11.

If your first two cards are a pair (e.g., two 8s), you can split them into two separate hands. Each hand gets a new second card, and you play them independently. A second bet equal to your first is placed on the new hand.
On the next screen, you\'ll be shown a player hand and a dealer up-card. Your task is to choose the correct action (Hit, Stand, Double Down, or Split) based on Basic Blackjack Strategy.
